timeline.message:
chore(engine): adjust telemetry configuration property

* renamed to `telemetryInitialized`
* considered only for the initial value of the telemetryEnabled db property

Related to CAM-12023
improve(test): cleanup db property only if the test is run

timeline.bodyText: I would prefer an active verb for this property, e.g. initializeTelemetry. The reason is that this property refers to something the engine does once on startup. Other properties that use passive voice (e.g. authorizationEnabled) refer to a state of the engine during its lifetime.
timeline.author: ThorbenLindhauer

timeline.bodyText: The Javadoc should be a bit more verbose to make it more clear what the configuration does. E.g. explain that this will initialize the telemetry configuration only once when it has never been enabled/disabled before. After that, it can only be changed via API.
timeline.author: ThorbenLindhauer

replies.bodyText: I extended the javadoc, could you please have a look
replies.author: yanavasileva

timeline.bodyText: Not directly related to the topic of this ticket: I think this API design is a bit confusing. To disable delemetry, I would write managementService.enableTelemetry(false) which is not intuitive to read. Maybe toggleTelemetry instead of enableTelemetry is more clear.
timeline.author: ThorbenLindhauer

replies.bodyText: I will change it in CAM-12078
replies.author: yanavasileva

timeline.bodyText: Not directly related to the topic of this ticket: Why is there no API method to check if telemetry is enabled?
timeline.author: ThorbenLindhauer

timeline.bodyText: Not directly related to the topic of this ticket: Why does the test method sleep for 2 seconds?
timeline.author: ThorbenLindhauer

replies.bodyText: thread2 to make progress before thread1 continues and finishes, otherwise, the concurrent situation might not happen if thread1 is faster. I guess this can be rewritten and improved (I didn't come up with how).
replies.author: yanavasileva

replies.bodyText: Yana and I discussed this and understood that the Thread.sleep is necessary. The threads block on the pessismistic lock and in the concurrency test we have no chance to be notified of that waiting, so the best solution to is to choose a timeout that makes it quite likely that a thread reaches that waiting point.
replies.author: ThorbenLindhauer
